item.title: Trees in ecological buffer zone to be felled, 14th September
item.description:
These trees were planted as a condition of the planning permission of Redwood Park to reduce impact of the development on the Russia Dock Woodland. After more than 10 years of slow growth, the management agents have decided the presence of these trees, along with plenty of other healthy trees in the development poses a future threat and have decided to fell without replacement on 22nd September 2025. These trees are food sources for the birds of the woodland, and have prevented bird strikes. It also reduces the visibility of the development from the woodlands. The planning permission only protected them for 5 years after completion of the development, I believe a tree protection order for the area is necessary.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downtown Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant dumping of household rubbish, 14th September
item.description:
Ongoing all the time (months /years), one of the houses along this strip keeps dumping their household rubbish on this section of the pavement instead of using their own front garden and bins. overflowing, piles up throughout the wk, incl dirty nappies etc

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Skipworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Really horrendous, intimidatory flags turning Orpington into Belfast, 14th September
item.description:
It’s just so unsightly. Poorly executed, tantamount to vandalism. Brings the whole area down. No problem people fixing flags to their own property, but this is taking over everyone’s space and intimidates people of colour. Takes us back to the days when the BNP would murder black and Asian teenagers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
